answerText: Fries rearrangement[10] AlCl3 can also be used in this doubly eponymous electrophilic aromatic substitution reaction that can result in either the acylation or alkylation of an arene such as benzene.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Virginia Commonwealth University  | 3 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Alternative methods include photochemical excitation and the use of sulfuric acid instead of hydrofluoric acid; however, the use of zeolites is not feasible since they are deactivating.  [10] Identify this reaction in which a phenyl ester is converted to either an ortho or para acyl phenol using a AlCl3 Lewis acid catalyst.
